meanings.definition: An apparatus used to measure the heat of chemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: Scientists used calorimeters to find out how much heat is released during a reaction.
meanings.sent2: The students in the chemistry lab learned how to operate calorimeters to study reactions.
meanings.sent3: The calorimeters at the lab were so busy measuring heat that they needed a break!
meanings.sent4: The calorimeters were like detectives, uncovering the secrets of chemical reactions through heat.
meanings.sent5: The shiny calorimeters hummed softly as they diligently recorded the heat changes.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure the heat capacity of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The new calorimeters were designed to accurately determine how much heat a substance can hold.
meanings.sent2: The scientist adjusted the settings on the calorimeters to measure the heat capacity of the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The calorimeters were so precise that they could even measure the heat capacity of a single drop of water.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science, calorimeters were like magical tools revealing the secrets of heat capacity.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by the calorimeters' ability to quantify the heat capacity of different materials.

meanings.definition: Instruments used to determine the heat produced by a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: Chemists rely on calorimeters to calculate the amount of heat generated in reactions.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician carefully monitored the calorimeters to record the heat output accurately.
meanings.sent3: The calorimeters in the lab seemed to have a competition on which could measure the most heat!
meanings.sent4: The calorimeters acted as silent witnesses, revealing the true heat levels of chemical reactions.
meanings.sent5: The professor demonstrated how to use calorimeters to analyze the heat produced in various reactions.
